title.narrative: Pak Flood Early Recov Grants to Aust &#38;#38;Foreign NGOs

description.narrative: This initiative provides support via grant payments to Australian and Foreign Non-Government Organisations (NGOs) to aid early flood recovery activities in Pakistan. Devastating floods swept Pakistan in July 2010. The floods inflicted immense social, economic and physical damage across the country. The grants are provided with the following outcomes to: 1) Save the Children Australia, to provide access to quality education for 10,500 flood-affected children and support to their families livelihoods in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa (KPK); 2) Caritas Australia, to restore livelihoods of around 10,000 flood-affected households in rural areas in Sindh and Balochistan; 3) ActionAid Australia, for water, sanitation and hygiene services (WASH) and livelihood opportunities for women in KPK and Punjab; 4) Oxfam Australia, to help restore on and off-farm livelihoods for 10,500 flood-affected people in KPK; and 5) RedR Australia, to deploy three trained health professionals to support the Health Cluster in

participating-org.narrative: Australia - Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade

organisation.narrative: Australia - Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade

mailing-address.narrative: R.G. Casey Building, John McEwen Crescent, Barton ACT 0221, Australia
